task.title: Configure the Storage Controller
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to configure the storage controller for the backend of your choice.

context.p: The Storage Controller (SC) provides functionality similar to the Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS). The SC can interface with various storage systems. Eucalyptus block storage (EBS) exports storage volumes that can be attached by a VM and mounted or accessed as a raw block device. EBS volumes persist past VM termination and are commonly used to store persistent data.
Eucalyptus provides the following open source (free) backend providers for the SC:

ul.li: Overlay - using the local file system
Direct Attached Storage - DAS-JBOD (just a bunch of disks)

context.p: Eucalyptus also offers the following subscription-based (paid) storage area network (SAN) backend providers for the SC:

ul.li: NetApp Data ONTAP - 7-mode as well as Clustered Data ONTAP storage

context.p: You must configure the SC to use one of the backend provider options.
